description: Dive into "Architectural Wonders of Thiruvananthapuram" — a handpicked list of places with quick notes, links, and essentials for fast trip planning and discovery.
title: Architectural Wonders of Thiruvananthapuram

places.generalDescription: Kanakakkunnu Palace, situated in Thiruvananthapuram, Kerala, is a splendid old royal palace that boasts a luxurious interior and lush grounds. It was once a prominent hub of the ancient Travancore kingdom and served as an entertaining ground for royal guests. Built in the 19th century by Sree Moolam Thirunal, it features Colonial architecture with typical Kerala style facade.

sources.snippet: Dipped in the heritage of a bygone era, the Kanakakkunnu Palace blends cultural splendor and human creativity in order to exist as a living representation of the Kerala-Gothic style of the Victorian era. Considered to be constructed by Sree Moolam Thirunal, a ruling Maharaj of Travancore back in 1885, the palace was used for the purpose of entertaining the guests and serving them non-vegetarian food.
sources.shortName: Historical landmarks in Trivandrum

sources.snippet: Kanakakkunnu Palace, located in Thiruvananthapuram, Kerala, is a prime example of Victorian-era architecture mingled with traditional Keralan styles. This historic structure is known for its red-bricked walls and white stone dressings. The palace served as the official residence for Sir C.P. Ramaswami Iyer during his time as Dewan.
sources.shortName: 10 Best Architectural Buildings in Thiruvananthapuram, India: A Cultural and Historical Tour – Engineers and Architects of America

sources.snippet: This museum has a rich history which you can explore on your visit. The architecture of this palace museum is beautiful. Currently, this palace is used as a venue to host different cultural events and activities.
sources.shortName: Famous Historical Places in Trivandrum

places.name: Kanakakkunnu Palace

reviews.text: It's a heritage place to visit in trivandrum, They used to do all kind of exhibition including government programs conducting here..People used to come here for relaxing in evenings.. A lovely calm and quite place unless any functions happening. It will be crowded in exhibition times usually happens like cultural events..

It's very calm and peaceful, although it is right in the heart of the city. A good place to be alone or with family or friends. I don't think the palace itself is accessible to visitors. But the area surrounding the palace is vast with lot of seats under shady trees. Best time to visit would be mornings and evenings. The famous Nishagandhi Auditorium is right next to the palace..,..

This is a great place to vibe and chill with family friends or even alone. The atmosphere is really relaxing and peaceful, perfect for a calm evening out. There are some functions that happen here occasionally, which adds to the lively feel. You can walk around, sit and rest in quiet spots, or just enjoy the greenery and open space. There's also a restaurant where you can grab something to eat and refresh yourself. A perfect spot to take a break from the busy city and spend time relaxing or hanging out.

places.address: Sooryakanthi Rd, Kanaka Nagar, Nanthancodu, Thiruvananthapuram, Kerala 695033, India

places.generalDescription: Sree Padmanabhaswamy Temple is a prominent feature of Thiruvananthapuram, part of a temple complex with a towering gateway and shrine to Padmanabha reclining on a serpent. The city also boasts other attractions like the Keralan Museum, Napier Museum, Kerala Government Secretariat, and various palaces and historical sites.

sources.snippet: The most important remnant of the past and a significant landmark of Trivandrum City is undoubtedly the Sree Padmanabhaswamy Temple built by King Marthanda Varma of the Travancore Royal Family in 1745. Dedicated to Lord Vishnu it is one of the oldest, most popular, and wealthiest temples in India. This is one of the main landmarks in Trivandrum.
sources.shortName: Historical landmarks in Trivandrum

sources.snippet: The temple is a beautiful example of Dravidian architecture featuring a gopuram. Dedicated to the Lord Vishnu, followers of Hinduism visit the temple throughout the year. Plated in gold, it has a ubiquitous presence of stone carvings and murals.
sources.shortName: Places to visit in Trivandrum for the Travelling Architect - RTF

sources.snippet: Padmanabhaswamy Temple is a significant Hindu temple dedicated to Vishnu. Located in Thiruvananthapuram, Kerala, this temple is known for its impressive architecture. It combines Kerala and Dravidian styles, featuring a 100-foot tall gopuram.
sources.shortName: 10 Best Architectural Buildings in Thiruvananthapuram, India: A Cultural and Historical Tour – Engineers and Architects of America

places.name: Sree Padmanabhaswamy Temple

reviews.text:
Visiting sacred Sree Padmanabhaswamy temple is a  complete bliss!!!
One of the oldest and richest shrines of Lord Vishnu, one can witness the lord in anantashyana posture through three doors of this temple. The architecture, divine energy and rich Kerala tradition well witnessed in this sacred place.

Tips for a pleasant visit:
1. Strict dress code to be followed by devotees ( traditional dress for women and only dhoti with towel for men) Shirt and T-shirts are not allowed
2. Temple dharshan timings are quite different from other temples....plan accordingly
3. Early morning Dharshan is less crowded, otherwise there is a waiting period of 1-2 hours as per crowd
4. Special VIP dharshan tickets are available only in-person inside the temple
5. Cloak rooms are available to keep valuable and cloth
6. It is nice to visit the nearby Ganesha temple along with it
7. There are four gates to enter, the east gate is more crowded.

Have recently visited and was deeply moved by the serene atmosphere and beautiful architecture. The intricate carvings and stunning deities created a sense of tranquility, allowing me to connect with my spirituality. The priests were warm and welcoming, offering insightful guidance and blessings. The community's dedication to preserving traditions and serving devotees is truly commendable. I felt a deep sense of peace and gratitude during my visit. Highly recommended for those seeking spiritual growth and connection.
Security is a bit high compared to any other religious places which may due to the wealthy nature of deity

I visited the temple during the weekend on a Saturday in July month. Instantly fell in love with the atmosphere and calmness inside and around the temple. It's really a divine place and you get to see the lord Vishnu in a resting posture and the spirituality, architecture, cleanliness, security and the experience is top notch.

I took the vip darshan with a ₹500 ticket and with this you can get the closest to the idol. I went at 8 am and you can enter through any of the four gates. Tickets are avilable inside the temple. After security check at the entrance head straight to the ticket counter and then joined the queue. Within 30 mins I was infront of lord Vishnu and asked for his blessings. No rush, no pushing and ample time in front of the idol was allowed. Post the darshana, I got prasadam which was included in the ticket price. Then visited lord Ganesha as well which is withing the temple complex. My heart and mind was at peace and I sat there admiring the temple architecture and beauty.

Temple timing are displayed at the entrance and special puja ticket of around ₹3000 is also available. Best time for free darshana is to go early morning when the temple opens at 3am.

Also please note that dress code need to be strictly followed and no electronic item are allowed inside the temple. You get locker and  bathing facility at nominal rates.

places.address: West Nada, Fort, East Fort, Pazhavangadi, Thiruvananthapuram, Kerala 695023, India

places.generalDescription: Infra I Nova Pvt. Ltd is a team of skilled architects specializing in innovative architectural designs for various projects such as apartments, homes, hospitals, offices, shopping centers, and townships. They prioritize comfort, space management, and designer appeal in every design or remodeling project they undertake. Clients appreciate their ability to provide multiple design options while considering all requirements and being readily available for discussions and changes.

sources.snippet:
I Nova Infra architects are a team of expert architects who
have a flair for innovative architectural designs. Their projects include apartments,
homes, hospitals, offices, shopping centers, commercial, and even townships. They
strive hard to ensure every single place they design or remodel has a perfect balance
of Comfort, Space Management and Designer Appeal.
sources.shortName: Top 7 Architects In Trivandrum

places.name: Infra I Nova Pvt. Ltd

reviews.text: Glad to give 5star to them.. they really deserve it... this is to there hard wrk and dedication... more to go infra... there is great way to you... ❣ there way of handling customers and customizing their needs are really good and worthy❣

Building a house has always been a dream for us and Infra I Nova have helped us achieve the dream. I was very skeptical about the construction in my plot due to its irregular orientation. After meeting and discussing with Mr.Christin I was given multiple options of design which helped  see the bigger picture. I really appreciate the design team for bringing forth multiple design options within a short span of time, considering all my requirements and always being available for discussions  and changes. The friendly approach of the entire team definitely helped me in being more comfortable in sharing the ideas I personally have about my house. Coming to the execution part the same friendly and approachable attitude is maintained throughout the process. The only drawback I was even though it was resolved later on was the communication and misinterpretations  during the final stage of the construction. Apart from that I really enjoyed the association  and living in
the  house since 2015 . Thank you for your sincere efforts and contributions. Wishing you for your future endeavors.

Giving 1 star as I don't have an option for 0 stars... Sorry for the long message.

It was during 2022, when I actively started searching for a good interior firm who could do the interior work for my apartment in Trivandrum.
I came across iNova infra from one of the YouTube videos that they published on their account. The Google reviews also suggested more than a 4.75 rating for them at that time!
I went to their office near Infosys (Trivandrum), had multiple discussions, a site visit, and finally handed over the work to them officially during the first week of August 2022.
Also paid the token advance during the second week of August. Till then, everything was going really well.
I was satisfied with the discussions we had, the quick responses to my messages/calls, the site visit they arranged - even though it was an ongoing work.

But things were different from the moment I paid the advance money (or when they got a hint that I was going to be with them for sure).
They started responding really late to my calls/messages (sometimes no response at all), and I was forced to visit their office a number of times to get some updates on the work status.
I was informed that the next steps would be to sign an agreement and also start the design work.
It took almost 3 weeks for them to prepare a draft agreement and also come up with a 'TV UNIT DESIGN' - after a number of follow-up calls/messages, visits, etc!!!
Upon suggesting one correction, it took them another 5 weeks to come back with the corrected TV unit design and a new KITCHEN UNIT design!!!
Again, after a number of calls/messages and 'visits' to their office!!!
Then it again took 3 more weeks for them to come up with a draft pooja unit and a wash unit design-after a number of follow-up calls/messages/visits, etc!!!

IN SHORT : the work that they initially assured to complete within 45–50 days of time period was not even initiated even after 3 months!
The progress they made was that they got the advance money from me and a few draft designs on which multiple corrections were suggested.

Finally, I lost all hope and called it off-by the end of Nov-2023.

I do have all the proofs (call logs, whatsapp messages, payment receipt, etc) to justify what I have written above.
I was thinking of filing a case against them legally, but I got busy with my apartment work.
Later, decided not to move in that direction and spend more of my time, energy, and more money.. Peace !!!! :)

I hope this review will be helpful for those who try to consider iNova Infra as an option.
From my experience, if you have a lot of time to do the work, then iNova Infra is definitely a good choice. But if you are trying to complete the work quickly, better search for other alternatives.

places.address: S Square Building, Opp. UST GLOBAL, Service Rd, near Technopark Phase 3, Kulathoor, Kazhakkoottam, Thiruvananthapuram, Kerala 695583, India

places.generalDescription: St. Mary's Malankara Syrian Catholic Major Archieparchial Cathedral, Pattom, situated in the neighborhood of Pattom in Thiruvananthapuram, is a renowned pilgrimage center for the Syro-Malankara Catholic Church. Consecrated in 1965 by Archbishop Benedict Mar Gregorios, this cathedral holds great historical and religious significance.

sources.snippet: St. Mary's Cathedral, Pattom is a beautiful Syrian Catholic Cathedral. The architecture of this cathedral is very beautiful. There are many historical facts related to this cathedral which you can explore on your visit.
sources.shortName: Famous Historical Places in Trivandrum

places.name: St. Mary's Syro-Malankara Catholic Major Archeparchial Cathedral, Pattom

reviews.text: What an incredible church! Despite being over 70 years old, its design incorporates modern touches. It appears to be entirely constructed from stone, making it a truly remarkable structure. The interior exudes a sense of peace and has a unique atmosphere. I visited it for a funeral and was surprised to discover such a hidden gem so close to my home.

A place of deep silence
I felt blessed
What a campus
Peaceful place ✝️Can visit Non christians also. Evanios ❤️

places.address: GWGQ+C77, Salem - Kochi, Panvel - Kochi - Kanyakumari Hwy, Vivekananda Nagar, Pattom, Thiruvananthapuram, Kerala 695004, India

places.generalDescription: Nestled in the vibrant heart of Thiruvananthapuram, the Mateer Memorial CSI Church stands as a remarkable testament to historical architecture and spiritual heritage. Established in 1906, this church is one of South India's oldest congregational churches, showcasing a beautiful Hallenkirche style that emphasizes simplicity and elegance. Constructed from granite, its striking Gothic arches create an inviting atmosphere for worshippers and visitors alike.

sources.snippet: Located in the heart of Thiruvananthapuram, CSI Mateer Memorial Church is a stunning example of historical architecture. Dedicated in 1906, this church is among the oldest in South India. The church features a simple Hallenkirche style, known for its uncluttered and elegant design.
sources.shortName: 10 Best Architectural Buildings in Thiruvananthapuram, India: A Cultural and Historical Tour – Engineers and Architects of America

places.name: Mateer Memorial CSI Church

reviews.text: The church is a sight to behold during the festive season, with its stunning lights and peaceful atmosphere, attracting visitors from far and wide.

The building is from early 1900s, made of granite and teak with a large nave, side aisles, bell tower, both transepts, with the chancel serving as the pulpit. The worship is more Presbyterian/Protestant in nature.
Divine services in English are held every Sunday at 10:00 am, the Divine service in Tamil is held at 7:00 am and three Malayalam Divine services take place at at 6:00 am, 8:30 am and 4:30 pm.
There're morning services daily at 7:00 am.
The church tends to be packed for the Sunday 8:30 and 10:00 am services.
The church offers excellent parking facilities.
Disabled access is available by the side aisles.

The Mateer Memorial Church is a Protestant church located in Thiruvananthapuram, India. It is under the Church of South India. It was built in December 1906, and is named after Rev. Dr. Samuel Mateer, a Scottish missionary who was instrumental in the establishment of the church.

The church is a beautiful example of the Gothic Revival style of architecture. It has a tall spire, pointed arches, and stained glass windows. The interior of the church is spacious and airy, with a large central nave and several side aisles.The atmosphere inside the church is serene and peaceful, making it the perfect place for quiet contemplation and prayer.

It is also a popular tourist destination, and is often featured in travel guides.

The X'mas fest at MM  Church was a truly magical and heartwarming experience. The church was adorned with festive decorations, twinkling lights, and beautiful nativity scenes, creating a joyful and welcoming atmosphere for all who attended.

places.address: LMS Compound, Palayam, Thiruvananthapuram, Kerala 695033, India

places.generalDescription: Napier Museum, located in Thiruvananthapuram, Kerala, is a 19th-century architectural marvel housing archaeological artifacts, historical relics, and art pieces. The museum features royal seats with Chinese engravings, a musical bow in mahogany, colored windows, and intricately painted and carved rosewood ceilings. Situated near the museum is the Kanakakunnu Palace which was once used as a summer retreat by the Travancore royal family to entertain guests.

sources.snippet: Located at the very heart of Trivandrum city is another main attraction popular for its magnificent architecture – the Napier Museum. Named after Mr. John Napier, the former Governor General of Madras, who inaugurated the new building, the Indo-Saracenic establishment houses a rare collection of archaeological and historical artifacts, ivory carvings, ancient coins, and ornaments.
sources.shortName: Historical landmarks in Trivandrum

sources.snippet: The Napier Museum in Thiruvananthapuram, Kerala, is an exquisite example of Indo-Saracenic architecture. This style fuses Indian, Mughal, and Gothic elements, creating a unique and visually stunning structure. Named after Lord Napier, a former British Governor, the museum is both an art and natural history institution.
sources.shortName: 10 Best Architectural Buildings in Thiruvananthapuram, India: A Cultural and Historical Tour – Engineers and Architects of America

sources.snippet: Built in the Indo-Saracenic style, it is a unique combination of Mughal, Chinese and Italian styles. It was developed by the Maharaja of Travancore in 1855 and showcases precious artifacts, bronze articles, ivory ornaments, and carvings. It also has a chariot and ancient musical instruments on display.
sources.shortName: Places to visit in Trivandrum for the Travelling Architect - RTF

places.name: Napier Museum

reviews.text:
Napier Museum is truly a gem in the heart of Thiruvananthapuram. It's a great place to take a relaxed walk, unwind, and enjoy some peaceful moments amidst nature-even while being right in the middle of the city. The area is quite spacious, making it ideal for peaceful seating, thoughtful discussions, or simply soaking in the serene atmosphere.

From big to small, famous to local, museums give us places to think, grow, learn, wonder, and feel. Few cultural institutions have remained as important as museums over the decades. They preserve and promote social interests as diverse and unique as the people who visit them-and Napier Museum is no exception.

A night walk here is something truly special-the calm surroundings, the cool breeze, and the beautifully lit pathways create a soothing ambiance that's perfect for reflection or quiet conversations.

Whether you're looking to reconnect with history, enjoy quiet time outdoors, or just take a refreshing stroll, Napier Museum offers something special for everyone. A must-visit for both locals and travelers alike.

One of the popular museums situated in the heart of the city and within the complex next to the famous Trivandrum zoo. One needs to buy a ticket to enter the museum and there is a paid parking facility available nearby.
The architecture of the museum and the park around captivate anyone very easily to visit it from afar. There are sculptures, displays and paintings inside but a limited experience. The place needs more maintenance and the continuous audio ads disturb the peaceful environment of the park.

Napier Museum: Where History, Nature & Calm Come Together 🏛️🌿🕊️

It's an experience that deserves an entire day to truly absorb. Spread across a huge, well maintained space, the place is spotlessly clean and beautifully organized, offering a calm escape right in the city.

The museum itself is free to enter, while the adjoining zoo entry costs just ₹50, which also includes a locker facility for bags and even plastic bottles a thoughtful touch for keeping the space clean. The zoo is expansive, and right outside, a small café serves as the perfect refresher after a walk.

What makes this venue special is the balance it offers: while the exhibits and zoo engage your curiosity, the grounds themselves invite you to slow down. There are plenty of shaded spots and tree-side seating areas, making it easy to pause, rest, or just take in the serene atmosphere. Despite the outside heat, the entire space feels naturally cooler, adding to the comfort.

Whether you're interested in history, looking to enjoy a day amidst nature, or simply searching for a peaceful retreat, Napier Museum is one of those rare places where you can do it all at once.

places.address: LMS Vellayambalam Rd, near Museum Junction, Kanaka Nagar, Nanthancodu, Thiruvananthapuram, Kerala 695033, India

places.generalDescription: Keralam - Museum of History and Heritage is an interactive museum located in Trivandrum, Kerala. Housed in a 120-year-old heritage building within the Kerala Tourism complex, it offers a comprehensive journey through Kerala's history and culture from the Neolithic age to the present day.

sources.snippet: Keralam Museum of History & Heritage is the state’s first thematic interactive museum. A joint venture of the Department of Tourism and Department of Cultural Affairs, Government of Kerala, the museum has a wide range of collections showcasing the journey of the state from pre-historic times to modern times. Narrative descriptions, multimedia systems, touch-screen kiosks, etc ensure a worthwhile infotainment experience for the visitors.
sources.shortName: Historical landmarks in Trivandrum

places.name: Keralam - Museum of History and Heritage

reviews.text:
Discover the essence of Kerala's rich history and heritage at this incredible museum! Keralam Museum is a hidden gem that takes you on a fascinating journey through the state's cultural, social, and artistic evolution. The exhibits are thoughtfully curated, with engaging displays and informative descriptions. The museum's architecture and ambiance are equally impressive, creating an immersive experience. Highlights include the vibrant traditional Kerala art, ancient artifacts, and insightful stories of the region's history. A must-visit for anyone interested in exploring the depths of Kerala's heritage. Well-maintained, friendly staff, and great value for money. Don't miss this treasure trove of Kerala's history.
Ticket - ₹20

Keralam- Museum of History and Heritage showcases Kerala's rich culture through artifacts, sculptures, traditional woodwork, and ancient manuscripts. It highlights the diverse history including its art, architecture and tribal traditions. The museum offers an engaging, immersive experience into Kerala's vibrant cultural legacy and historical evolution. The ticket rate is 20 for the adults and it was Worth it!

Best place to know more about Ancient Kerala's socio-economic and religious culture. They have used advanced technological aids to provide more background information of these periods. Even recreated models are present which makes us not just see them but also experience it.

places.address: Corporation Office Tourism Directorate Compound, LMS Vellayambalam Rd, near Thiruvananthapuram, University of Kerala Senate House Campus, Palayam, Thiruvananthapuram, Kerala 695033, India

places.generalDescription: Located in Kovalam, the Rock Cut Cave Shiva Temple is a must-visit for history and spirituality enthusiasts. Dating back to the 8th century, this temple is carved from rock and showcases intricately crafted sculptures and ancient architectural marvels. The serene ambiance and beautiful surroundings make it an ideal spot for a romantic stroll. The temple features a large natural well and a shrine that appears to be suspended in the sky due to its unexcavated nature.

sources.snippet: Vizhinjam Rock-cut Temple is one of the oldest rock-cut temples in Kerala, believed to have been constructed by the Ay dynasty rulers in the 8th century AD. Located at the seaside hamlet of Vizhinjam, the rock-cut sculptures house the one-celled shrine of Vinandhara Dakhinamurthi and an outer wall depicting the unfinished statue of Lord Shiva and Parvati.
sources.shortName: Historical landmarks in Trivandrum

sources.snippet: Built in the 18th century, the Rock Cave temples are located in the village of Vizhinjam. The temple is unfinished and probably is the reason why it still holds its unique charm in its rock-cut idols and beautiful rock carvings. The idol of Lord Shiva and Goddess Parvati is engraved here and is the highlights of the temple.
sources.shortName: Famous Historical Places in Trivandrum

places.name: Rock-Cut Cave Shiva Temple, Vizhinjam

reviews.text:
Aazhimala Shiva Temple is a revered Hindu shrine dedicated to Lord Shiva, situated in the picturesque coastal town of Thiruvananthapuram, Kerala. This ancient temple is renowned for its stunning architecture, serene atmosphere, and breathtaking ocean views. Aazhimala Shiva Temple is a must-visit destination for spiritual seekers, architecture enthusiasts, and nature lovers. The temple's scenic location, architectural marvel, and peaceful ambiance make it an ideal spot for reflection, meditation, and connection with the divine.
Aazhimala Shiva Temple is an enchanting destination that offers a unique blend of spirituality, architecture, and natural beauty. Plan your visit to experience the tranquility and divine energy of this sacred shrine.

Vizhinjam Rock-Cut Cave, located near the coastal town of Vizhinjam in Thiruvananthapuram district( Near to vizhinjam police station ) This small yet significant cave is renowned for its ancient rock-cut sculptures and inscriptions, making it a must-visit destination for history enthusiasts, archaeologists, and tourists.The Vizhinjam Rock-Cut Cave dates back to the 8th century AD and is believed to have been built during the reign of the Ay dynasty, a prominent ruling dynasty in southern Kerala. The cave temple reflects the early phase of Dravidian architecture and serves as an important relic of the region's ancient history. The sculptures and inscriptions found within the cave provide valuable insights into the religious practices, artistic styles, and cultural influences of that era.
Not much to see but must visit for spiritual and history enthusiasts. A positive energy engulfs the place . Though it's written as Dhakshinamurti I wonder if the place has some Jain connection.

places.address: Police Station, Vizhinjam, Kovalam, Kerala 695521, India

sources.snippet: We are blessed to do service now in the Land of Sree Padmanabhaswamy ; Just 1 kilometre from the Great Sree Padmanabhaswamy Temple Thiruvananthapuram . We Ensure Professionalism, Quality , Reliability and affordability in all our services. With a dedicated proven team of Engineers, Architects , Structural , 3D and Surveying Team and with the appreciation of Past 16 years Clients we are now focusing service all over Southern Kerala from the Head office in East Fort Trivandrum.

reviews.text: Completed my dream home and honestly a great experience working with Adhvait architectural & Vastu Building Designs. 100 percentage vastu meets with contemporary architecture. Our requirements now become reality. Proper working drawings helps us to monitor and optimise elements in each stage especially in electrical, plumbing, and interiors. Structural works been monitored and inspections from Engineers helps to even correct mistakes in construction. Thank you for the amazing design.
Recommended firm super service best architecture firm in Thiruvananthapuram. Thanks to All engineers and architects team Adhvait

I recently had the pleasure of working with Adhvait Architectural & Vasthu Building Designs for a renovation project on my home, and I couldn't be more pleased with the results. From the initial consultation to the final touches, their team was professional, creative, and incredibly attentive to my needs and vision. They listened carefully to my ideas, offered thoughtful suggestions, and helped bring my dream renovation to life with skill and precision. The design they proposed was not only functional but also beautifully executed, blending modern aesthetics with the character of my home. I also appreciate their transparency and communication, making the entire renovation process smooth
Overall, I highly recommend them to anyone looking for top-notch architectural and design services. Their professionalism, expertise, and passion for their craft are evident in every aspect of their work. Thank you for transforming my home into a space I'll love for years to come!

places.address: 1st Floor Fathima Building , Eenchakkal, 1km Near Padmanabhaswamy Temple, Enchakkal Attakulangara Road Eenchakkal Junction, Vallakkadavu P O, Signalnearby, Eanchakkal, Thiruvananthapuram, Kerala 695008, India

places.generalDescription: Koyikkal Palace, a traditional 2-story Kerala palace dating back to 1677, is home to folklore and numismatics museums. The Keralam Museum has implemented modern techniques in refurbishing archaeological museums at various locations and played a pivotal role in establishing district heritage museums across the region. This historical site is one of the major tourist attractions in Thiruvananthapuram, offering visitors a glimpse into Kerala's rich cultural heritage.

sources.snippet: Koyikkal Palace located in Nedumangad, Thiruvananthapuram is a living symbol of the extravagance of traditional architecture which prevailed in Kerala during the Seventeenth century. It is a double-story palace built in the conventional Nalukettu architectural style of Kerala for Umayamma Rani, the regent of the Venad Royal family between 1677 and 1684. It currently hosts a Folklore and Numismatics Museum with a rich antique collection.
sources.shortName: Historical landmarks in Trivandrum

sources.snippet: Koyikkal Palace is a 16th century palace located 15 kilometers from Trivandrum. The Palace is known for its classic layout, design true to the Travancore style and is a hotspot for Archaeology buffs as its accommodates a Folklore museum and a Numismatics museum. The museums contain some of the rarest collections around the world.
sources.shortName: Famous Historical Places in Trivandrum

places.name: Koyikkal Palace

reviews.text: Koyikkal Palace is a calm and beautiful place in Kerala. The palace is built in the traditional Kerala style with wooden walls and sloping roofs. Inside, there is a small museum that shows interesting items about the history and royal life of Kerala. The palace is surrounded by trees and nature, making it a peaceful place to visit. It's a great spot for anyone interested in history or looking for a quiet place to relax.

Koyikkal Palace in Nedumangad is  a peaceful place with serious old-world vibes. It's not one of those massive royal palaces, but what it lacks in size, it makes up for in charm and history.

The building itself is this beautiful old Kerala-style structure with sloping tiled roofs and wooden beams-super traditional and photogenic. You can literally feel the history in the air. It was built way back in the 1600s.

Inside, there are museums. The Folklore Museum has some really cool stuff like old musical instruments, traditional lamps, costumes, and even tools people used ages ago. On the ground floor is the coin museum, Ancient coins collections are there. The place isn't crowded at all-perfect if you want a quiet, thoughtful afternoon. The gardens around the palace are also nice, and it's a great spot if you're into photography, culture, or just want a chill outing away from the usual city spots.

Koyikkal Palace in Nedumangadu is a beautiful historic spot that perfectly blends culture and architecture. The palace is well-maintained, and the museum inside is very informative, showcasing traditional Kerala artifacts, coins, and antiques. The calm and peaceful surroundings make it a great place to spend some quiet time while exploring history. A must-visit for anyone interested in Kerala's heritage.

places.address: Sathram Junction, Pazhavadi, Nedumangad, Kerala 695541, India

places.generalDescription: EGO Design Studio is a team of architects who graduated from Thangal Kunju Musaliar College of Engineering, Kollam, in Kerala, India. The group decided to come together in 2009 and started their own studio. The architects are known for designing contemporary residences and religious buildings.

sources.snippet:
EGO Design Studio is the confluence of a team of amazing architects
who graduated from the Department of Architecture, Thangal Kunju Musaliar
College of Engineering, Kollam, in Kerala, India. Having started their
respective career journeys at different offices of renowned architects of
Kerala and beyond, this team finally decided to come together in 2009 to fulfill

reviews.text: I'm extremely satisfied with the exceptional care and service I received at Thiruvananthapuram Medical College Hospital. Authorities should take action on this. They have to construct/ provide some places to bystanders /relatives coming with patients in medical college.

Kerala's top most medical college is situated in the capital city of Thiruvananthapuram.
The majority of patients coming here are economically weaker than they can't afford private hospitals.
Doctors, Nurses working here are the best in the state. They also have a prestigious salary.

The number of people from almost all the parts of Kerala is depending on the Thiruvananthapuram medical college, One reason is that here they have the most advanced doctors and technology.
The major drawback is the hospital can't afford these much of people and patients and bystanders are sleeping floors with just  bedsheets.
The number of doctors, nurses and other staff are not appropriate to look after all these patients.

The bathrooms are ugly and they are not maintaining it properly.

places.generalDescription: Kanakakunnu Palace Rd is a charming thoroughfare that encircles the historic Kanakakunnu Palace, set amidst beautifully landscaped grounds. The palace boasts ancient relics such as royal seats with Chinese engravings, a musical bow in mahogany, and intricately painted and carved rosewood ceilings. Constructed of wood from nearby forests, the palace is located at the foot of the Veli Hills near the river Valli.

sources.snippet: Built during the late 19th century by Sree Moolam Thirunal, the Kanakakunnu Palacewas used to entertain guests of The Royal family of Travancore. The palace is known for its iconic red-colored building with classic Travancore facades, beautiful royal furniture, and chandeliers which light up the whole place and give it its authentic charm. Today the palace accommodates two auditoriums- Nishagan...

We recently had opportunity to work with Armson Homes for renovation of kitchen ,bathroom and minor interior works and indoor painting of our first floor. Credits goes to Mr. Manoj for showcasing high level of professionalism , work ethics and his value to client satisfaction .I appreciate that the installment  was requested only after completion of that portion of work.
My day to day interaction with Armson was through Sreelekshmi who coordinated the things very well and was quick to respond to any query.
Coming to Quality of work , One section of work which I felt exceptional are the structural part ie the work of footing , plinth beams and brick work etc. Furthermore post the work they would neatly clean the site which is rare . The delivery of modular kitchen cabinets under workmanship of Shiju , work of Aluminum crockery , the electrical dept. , tilework were also too good.
The sections which I felt could be made better would be the painting and plumbing works.
Overall Quite satisfied with the deliverable . All the best team Armson Homes. Going for 4 star due to overshoot of the scheduled work which had caused little inconvenience as it was a live house.

Armson Homes did renovation work for my Home located at Nettayam which included complete revamp of bathrooms,  wardrobes, Kitchen, Crockery Shelf, Garden work, etc. The work was carried out while I was located in Bangalore. Manoj could effectively communicate and understand my requirements with minimal face to face meeting and communication was effective over the calls. Armson team has good skilled workers and they carried out all the work with quality. Also they addressed a few maintenance requests timely after the work completion. I recommend Armson Homes for interior design and renovation work based on my experience and wish them all the very best.

places.generalDescription: Kowdiar Palace, situated approximately 4 km from Trivandrum, serves as the official residence of the current Maharajah of Travancore. Constructed by Maharaja Moolam Thirunal in the 20th century, this architectural gem showcases a splendid fusion of Travancore-style design and architecture. The palace is steeped in history and is surrounded by well-maintained grounds, making it a must-visit destination in Kerala.

sources.snippet: Royalty in India is not uncommon and even though a small city, Trivandrum adores the Kowdiar Palace. The palace was built in the early 20th century and gifted by Sri Moolam Thirunaal to Sethu Parvati Bayi. The palace is the functional home of the Travancore royal family and is restricted for Public visits.
sources.shortName: Famous Historical Places in Trivandrum

places.name: Kowdiar Palace

reviews.text:
Kowdiar Palace is one of the most astonishing landmarks of Thiruvananthapuram city, Kerala.
Situated in a small hillock in Kowdiar, it received its name.
The building is a magnificent two-storied residential structure with 105 rooms and boasts traditional architecture with  a blend of foreign woven to it.
The awe-inspiring palace stands as a testimony of the erstwhile Travancore Royal Family, in which the predecessors of the same are residing.
The palace itself is a granduer and is adorned with lots of artifacts from the erstwhile rulers of the dynasty, including their portraits and other stuff.
It itself is a great museum of our city's rich cultural heritage.
Being residential in nature, you have to seek prior permission to visit the premises and to feel its architecture.

Kowdiar Palace is shown open to the public. But unfortunately there in no access to the public. When you are near the gate the police will inform you are not allowed to enter.

Entry to the palace is allowed only twice a year for the kings birthday and death anniversary.

Kowdiar Palace, located in Thiruvananthapuram, Kerala, is the official residence of the Travancore Royal Family. Built in 1934 by Maharajah Sree Chithira Thirunal Balarama Varma as a wedding gift for his sister, Karthika Thirunal Lakshmi Bayi, the palace remains a significant historical landmark.

Architecture and Features

The palace is a three-story structure with over 150 rooms, showcasing a blend of Kerala and Dravidian architectural styles.

It is set on a lush estate covering about 100 acres, offering a serene atmosphere away from the city's hustle and bustle.

Kowdiar Palace is home to Kerala's very first elevator, imported from Italy, and it is still fully operational today.

Current Status

Kowdiar Palace continues to serve as a private residence for members of the Travancore Royal Family.

Entry to the palace interiors is not permitted for the public.

Visitors are welcome to view and admire the palace from the outside, but access beyond the gates is restricted.

Visitor Guidelines

If you plan to visit, you can enjoy the magnificent view of the palace from outside the premises.

Since public entry is not allowed, it is advisable to respect the privacy of the residents and avoid attempting to enter.

Kowdiar Palace stands as a proud reminder of Kerala's rich history and cultural heritage, serving as a living testimony to the legacy of the Travancore royal lineage.

places.generalDescription: Ayyankali Hall, also known as VJT Hall, is a historic town hall in Thiruvananthapuram, Kerala. Originally built to commemorate the 50th anniversary of Queen Victoria's coronation, it now serves as an iconic venue for cultural events and art exhibitions. The architecture reflects the 80s culture of Kerala and has been well-maintained to preserve its traditional look.

sources.snippet: VJT Hall, also known as Victoria Jubilee Town Hall, is located in Thiruvananthapuram, Kerala. This notable building was constructed to celebrate the golden jubilee of Queen Victoria’s reign in 1896. The hall was inaugurated by Sree Moolam Thirunal Rama Varma, the Maharaja of Travancore.
sources.shortName: 10 Best Architectural Buildings in Thiruvananthapuram, India: A Cultural and Historical Tour – Engineers and Architects of America

places.name: Mahatma Ayyankali Hall (VJT Hall)

reviews.text: Heritage building.  At Palayam. Opposite University College Trivandrum. Now suitable for conducting craft exhibition. Gone for seeing a handicraft exhibition here.

Mahatma Ayyankali Hall, formerly known as VJT hall located at Palayam, Thiruvananthapuram.
This hall is a cultural heritage and symbol of the olden days in Kerala. Started as Victoria Jubilee Town hall by britishers to commemorate birth anniversary of queen Victoria, the hall later evidenced to several historical moments. Sree Moolam Prajasabha, a parliamentary forum of elected and nominated members assembled here which was organized during Travancore royal rule.
Currently this town hall comes under the cultural Department of state of kerala and named after famous Renaissance leader, Shri. Ayyankali.
Now townhall stages major events in the city including cultural fests, book fests, Art exhibitions, Agro Expos, Handicraft exhibitions etc..
Townhall is easily accessible from the MG road. Only a small parking facility is available inside. Garden infront of the hall looks good.

Architecture is so good,I could feel the old wood art.
Neat and clean
Near university college Thiruvananthapuram

sources.snippet: The academic philosophy of DCSAAD aims at a holistic, sustainable and inte­grated approach through traditional and contemporary teaching-learning prac­tices for developing the individuality & selfesteem in each student and to add values to their responsibilities as a social being. The design studios and courses have been meticulously detailed for students to understand architecture as a multifaceted discipline, a thought process and away of life which is highly empathetic to the people and surroundings. Highly process oriented discourses which are deep-rooted in personal narra­tives blent with the stories of people and place enable the student to perceive the perceptional, behavioural and psychological dimensions of space and to translate the thoughts into built forms.

places.name: TESLA Pedagogy Park

reviews.text:
It is a very nice Science Park. Though please be aware it is only open for educational institutions to visit.   You need to call and book your visit and the park will be open exclusively for you.  As of now they welcome only one group per day.     You are required to report in the morning 09.30am and stay back till evening 4:30pm

The visit involves a lecture-cum-interaction section with Suresh Sir, followed by multiple lab visits.   Each lab the volunteers walk you through a series of experiments, and then lets the kids to do experiments themselves.   There is a lot of enthusiasm from the organizers' side.    One must carry a pen and notebook so that they can note down observations and potential questions.  Finally there is a closing lecture-cum-interaction.

The visit is long. But it is really worth it.    You can take a break in between from experiments and play some small games like darts etc that is set up.

Food is not available in the location.   Either you could carry food or ask Suresh Sir to give some caterer's contact who will serve it.

GREAT EXPERIENCE
I visitee this place when I was studiying in 10th standard and I still feel nostalgic when I think about this place💜

places.name: S Squared Architects Pvt Ltd.

reviews.text: They design buildings with context to the site and environment. They use the advanced BIM software for every consturction purpose drawings.

When we wanted to build our dream home, we knew that the role of the architect is going to be super important. After meeting a few architects, we chose S Squared architects and it was one of the best decisions we made. The combination of professionalism, their skills not only in the domain of architecture but also in the interactions and understanding our needs is commendable.
The design of the patio, the connectivity among some of the rooms in the ground floor, cross ventilation, bringing natural light as an element in the design, unique blend of architecture and comfort for living- these were the highlights.
The end result did exceed our expectations and I would highly recommend S Squared architecture to build your dream home.
The best Architect firm located in Trivandrum having offices in Cochin and Delhi… Great designs and timely completion of projects  @ affordable rates….

places.name: Sun Projects India Pvt Ltd

reviews.text:
If anyone asks me about some keywords about this builder, I will start with these - Friendly, Genuine and Trustworthy!

From the first day in their office (almost a year before) till now, we receive the same smiley, down to earth approach in our dealings. Very clear and transparent on documentation and all other relational paper works, they always keep you posted on different statuses they work on. Deepthi, Sreethu, GM, Finance - they made us to feel like, we are part of Sun Homes!

Keep up the great work Sun Projects!

Sun Projects India (P) Ltd is a company incorporated under the Companies Act 1956 with its registered office at Trivandrum, Kerala. Sun Projects is an ISO 9001:2015 certified company. Our main objective is to provide high-quality building construction and ensure timely delivery to our clients. The debut apartment project of the company is Sun Sapphire at Kesavadasapuram which was completed in December 2008. Over the years, we have grown substantially and gradually, we took up commercial complexes and independent villa projects.
SUN PROJECTS HAS SEVERAL UNIQUE AND SIGNIFICANT FEATURES THAT HELPS TO ATTAIN CUSTOMER SATISFACTION
